Merge sort algorithm using javascript

Arun v Â  in India
Mon Jun 14 2021
  • Algorithm
  • Sort
  • MergeSort
  • JavaScript

Merge sort is one of the most efficient sorting algorithms. It works on the principle of Divide and Conquer. Merge sort repeatedly breaks down a list into several sublists until each sublist consists of a single element and merging those sublists in a manner that results into a sorted list.

so for this example we are using array of number to make it as simple as possible

let arr = [
    2,5,8,5,9,6,0,4,3,7,1
]

we are going to use recurring function for it, don't worry if you don't know how it works basically it's a function which returns itself based on a certain condition

let arr = [
    2,5,8,5,9,6,0,4,3,7,1
];

function sortArr(par) {
    for (let i = 0; i < par.length; i++) {
        // current element
        const el = par[i];
        // next element
        const er = par[i+1];
        // check if the is a element on right side
        if (typeof er != "undefined") {
            // check if the element on right is greater than element on left
            if (er < el) {
                // swapping the element on left with right
                par[i] = er;
                par[i+1] = el;
                /**
                 * returning the same function with sorted value 
                 * as it's parameter
                 */
                return sortArr(par);
            }
            // if the element in right is greater than that of left then the loop will continue
        }
    }
    // return the sorted array
    return par;
}

let sortedArr = sortArr(arr);
console.log(sortedArr);
// output
// [
//   0, 1, 2, 3, 4,
//   5, 5, 6, 7, 8,
//   9
// ]

as you can say by the code merge sort is not that efficient for a larger array as it has to cycle through all the elements in the array multiple time to sort it, but if performance is not your main concern then merge sort will be a simple and reliable way.

their is a sorter way of doing it using the build in sort method with just single line of code.
